results.title: Quaternions: A herald of modern algebra (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of Mathematics”.
A key mathematical development in modern algebraic ideas was the discovery of non-commutative algebras. William Rowan Hamilton worked on complex numbers and expressed them formally as pairs of real numbers. His work led him to try to generalise his ideas to three dimension but his generalisation to four dimensions led to the quaternion and the first non-commutative algebra.

results.title: Numbers now and then (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jean Nunn, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of Mathematics”.
Concerns the history of written numbers. Illustrates different features of the numeral systems of the ancient Babylonians, Egyptians and Greeks. Explains the Hindu-Arabic origin of our number system.

results.title: The History of inventions
results.creator_credit: Bruno Bozzetto, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: Bozetto claims that it was lightning that first showed man the wonders of fire and set him on the hazardous path of invention. Since primitive times man’s inventive itch has never been at rest; now we finds ourselves living on a planet so endangered by our inventions that we may well have to escape to another world to find the peace necessary to go on inventing. In English and Italian.

results.title: History lesson
results.brief_description: A song in the folk idiom about a history lesson illustrated with newsreel footage of recent historical events such as the first atomic bomb, Hitler, Nazi rallies, Neville Chamberlain, scenes of poverty in Asian countries, and the Vietnam War.

results.title: History brought to life
results.creator_credit: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Shows the work done by Hollywood research experts in bringing accuracy of mood and detail to motion picture versions of significant historical periods. The film is introduced and narrated by Cecil B de Mille.

results.title: Histoire de poissons
results.brief_description: A third language training film relating adventures of the Martin family. The family is on holiday in France and M. Martin is out fishing - Monsieur le Cure is coming for dinner and, being Friday, fish is essential. The foibles of promising a fish dinner are developed, wherein each member of the family purchases a fish to make sure there will be plenty for the dinner guest.

results.title: Sai Baba: his life is his message
results.creator_credit: Richard Boch and Spiritual Advancement of the Individual Foundation
results.brief_description: Traces the life of Sai Baba, the leader. The film visually records Sai Baba’s many miracles as they happen, through the eyes of a scientist. The film also carries the universal message of Sathya Sai Baba.
